what: R: The open statistical computing project
title: Companion Package for Book An Introduction to Spatial Data Analysis and Statistics
text: R? R open-source language statistical computing. created early 1990s Ross Ihaka Robert Gentleman University Auckland, New Zealand, way provide students accessible, -cost statistical application courses. R now maintained R Development Core Team, continues developed hundreds contributors around globe. R attractive alternative software packages data analysis (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Matlab, Stata, ArcGIS) due open-source character (.e., free), flexibility, large user community. size R community means something want (instance, estimate linear regression model plot geographical information), likely someone already developed package R. good way think R core package, library optional packages can attached increase core functionality. R can downloaded free : https://cran.rstudio.com/ R comes built-console (graphical user interface), better alternatives basic interface include Interactive Development Environments like RStudio, can also downloaded free: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ R requires work using command line, going unfamiliar many accustomed user-friendly graphical interfaces. fear. People worked long time using command line, using even cumbersome systems, punched cards early computers. Graphical user interfaces convenient, major drawback, namely inflexibility. program functions based graphical user interfaces allows hard-coded user interface. what: A funcion for creating an interactive map of local Moran's I statistics — localmoran.map
title: A funcion for creating an interactive map of local Moran's I statistics — localmoran.map
text: function plots map results local Moran's statistics, based spatial polygons, listw object, variable ID.

title: A funcion for creating an interactive map of local Moran's I statistics — localmoran.map
code: localmoran.map(p = p, listw = listw, VAR = VAR, by = by)

title: A funcion for creating an interactive map of local Moran's I statistics — localmoran.map
text: p simple features sf object listw listw object (see spdep) VAR name variable name key join local Moran's statistics sf object

title: A funcion for creating an interactive map of local Moran's I statistics — localmoran.map
code: # Create a map of local Moran's I statistics for population density # # Obtain a listw object for the contiguities. First obtain the neighbors: Hamilton_CT.nb <- spdep::poly2nb(as(Hamilton_CT, "Spatial")) #> Error in .class1(object): object 'Hamilton_CT' not found # Based on the neighbors, obtain a listw object: Hamilton_CT.w <- spdep::nb2listw(Hamilton_CT.nb) #> Error in spdep::nb2listw(Hamilton_CT.nb): object 'Hamilton_CT.nb' not found  localmoran.map(Hamilton_CT, Hamilton_CT.w, "POP_DENSITY", "TRACT") #> Error in transmute(p, key = p[[by]], Z = (p[[VAR]] - mean(p[[VAR]]))/var(p[[VAR]]),     SMA = lag.listw(listw, Z), Type = factor(ifelse(Z < 0 & SMA <         0, "LL", ifelse(Z > 0 & SMA > 0, "HH", "HL/LH")))): object 'Hamilton_CT' not found
